samples.question: How often do you watch TV?
samples.transcript: I mean, now that I am a student, I do not have a lot of time, so I would say twice a week. Yeah. Not that often. All right.
samples.transcript_original: Uh, I mean, now that I'm a student, I don't have a lot of time, so I would say twice a week. Yeah. Not that often. All right.
samples.transcript_cleaned: I mean, now that I am a student, I do not have a lot of time, so I would say twice a week. Yeah. Not that often.

samples.question: And when you watch TV, what kind of TV programs do you like to watch?
samples.transcript: I, since I get very stressed because of my student life, I try to watch just comedy show. I do not like watching dramatic, TV show or anything too serious. So kind of like, for example, other family, friends, those kind of TV show are the best for me. Okay.
samples.transcript_original: Uh, I, since um, I get very stressed because of my student life, I try to watch just comedy show. I don't like watching dramatic, uh, TV show or anything too serious. So kind of like, for example, other family, friends, those kind of TV show are the best for me. Okay.
samples.transcript_cleaned: I, since I get very stressed because of my student life, I try to watch just comedy show. I do not like watching dramatic, TV show or anything too serious. So kind of like, for example, other family, friends, those kind of TV show are the best for me.

samples.question: And what are the most popular TV shows in your country?
samples.transcript: Oh, huh. Actually in Italy, we do not have a lot of TV show, itself. Like we have a lot of like, we would say, like telenovelas, kind of like that. But, I think there is one that could be similar to Friends that is, is called Camera Café, but it is old. So, so yeah, I mean, it is kind of a, a tricky question. Because Italians do not watch a lot of TV show. They like drama. Yeah, so. Okay.
samples.transcript_original: Oh, huh. Actually in Italy, we don't have a lot of TV show, uh, itself. Like we have a lot of like, we would say, like telenovelas, kind of like that. samples.question: And has the internet affected your viewing habits?
samples.transcript: Yeah, for sure. I do watch a lot of TV show or like internet show on YouTube, way more often because of course it is easier and you can watch it everywhere. So I would say yes. Very good. Thank you for answering those questions. Now we are going to talk about books.
samples.transcript_original: Yeah, for sure. I do watch a lot of TV show or like internet show on YouTube, uh, way more often because of course it's easier and you can watch it everywhere. So I would say yes. Very good. Thank you for answering those questions. Now we're going to talk about books.

samples.question: How often do you read?
samples.transcript: These days, when it comes to study, I do read a lot because my major is international relations, so we have to read articles basically every day. So I would say sometime I would read 100 pages a week, but books just for me, during my leisure time, not that often anymore. So I would say maybe one book and four months, so not that often. Okay.
samples.transcript_original: Um, these days, um, when it comes to study, I do read a lot because my major is international relations, so we have to read articles basically every day. Okay.

samples.question: And do you have many books at home?
samples.transcript: Oh, not really, because I do use e-books more often. it is way easier. so no. Okay.
samples.transcript_original: Oh, not really, because I do use e-books more often. It's way easier. Uh, so no. Okay.
samples.transcript_cleaned: Oh, not really, because I do use e-books more often. it is way easier.

samples.question: And do you prefer to buy books or borrow them?
samples.transcript: Borrow, for sure. I am an eco-friendly person, so if I have the chance to borrow some books or go to a second-hand book, bookstore, I would do. Okay.
samples.transcript_original: Borrow, for sure. I am an eco-friendly person, so if I have the chance to borrow some books or go to a second-hand book, uh, bookstore, I would do. Okay.

samples.question: And what are the benefits of reading?
samples.transcript: Of course, there are a lot of benefit. but, for me, for example, I tend to read things that I do enjoy the most. You get to know more about the world. You get to know more about yourself. And you question more yourself or even you use more your imagination So there are a lot of benefits Okay thank you so much for answering all my questions.

samples.question: Okay, if you are ready, could you begin speaking about it?
samples.transcript: Yes, so my topic was to talk about a company that I do know. And the first one that came to my mind was Samsung, because we are here in Korea. And for sure, it is one of the largest companies in the world. So everyone knows about it. And what I found it successful about Samsung, and I actually started about it when I was young, it was one of my teachers when I was in high school. And it was very fascinating to get to know how and how he got successful because if I am not wrong, the CEO in the beginning was selling rice cakes and he got so, you know, he was very, determined to succeed. So, I always find it very, very fascinating. And, however, when it comes to the working environment, I have a lot of friends that work for Samsung and it is very competitive. And, I mean, this is probably my personal opinion, but I, I do think it is, it is not one of the best working environment. it is very hard. it is, it is tough. You have to work for a lot of Howard and even just to get in. I know that the selection, they have like four interviewers. So I do not know if I would work there, but for sure it is a very successful company. And, what I would say is like different from any other company when it comes to Samsung is that they sell everything. Like you can go to a Samsung store and just to buy a TV or, of course a phone and you can also buy a fridge or I do not know, like an air conditioner. So it is something that I always find so, unique and something that is very different from most of other competitors when it comes to, companies and organizations. Thank you for answering all those questions.

samples.question: Are there many big companies in your country?
samples.transcript: We do have a lot of big companies but they are mostly related to food because, you know, Italy is famous for food. So for example, Barilla is the one that comes to my mind or an espresso. Because Italians are very, I would say snob about food. Unfortunately, that is the stereotype, but it is true. so we do care so much about our food brand and everything has to be perfect. And for example, my hometown is Parma. So it is famous for Parmesan and for pasta. So, people do care so much about it and the working environment is so selective, but it is also like, engaging. that is also what I love about Italian food company. Cause I do not see it here or in other countries, for example. So definitely there are some major food companies in Italy.
samples.transcript_original: We do have a lot of big companies but they're mostly related to food because, you know, Italy is famous for food. samples.question: What about car companies?

samples.question: Are there also like family like owned?
samples.transcript: Those, of course, those companies are successful. But I would say, that is what a lot of my friends ask me because everyone thinks that Italians do own a Ferrari, but it is not actually an Italian thing. I think it is just, something that just rich people can afford. So I do think it is like, a family kind of environment when it comes to Ferrari. it is a luxury one. So, mostly Italian tradition are like all based on simple things, simple food. So I do not think that Ferrari or those kind of company actually represent Italian, tradition or Italian people. But, of course they are very successful and they are very detail oriented. And, yeah, I mean, the cars are nice. Yeah, they are, definitely.

samples.question: In, in Italy or like in general?
samples.transcript: In general. I would say large company, this is also like a personal opinion, but most of the time large company do get money mostly by exploiting people. So like it is, I do think they of course maybe sell different type and a variety of items and they have, maybe different, they, they work in different cities. So, of course, compared to like small companies where there are just few employees and, and of course, maybe you get paid less and it is not as competitive and the working environment, maybe it is not as. Pressuring, but like the competition as we see nowadays, it is unbearable for little or small companies. So that is a huge gap in my opinion. Definitely.

samples.question: Have you ever worked for like a small or big company?
samples.transcript: Not yet. but I do have a lot of friends and all my family that work for like small companies and they struggle every day in Italy. And then you mentioned before you wanted to work for like an international organization.

samples.question: Why do some people like you choose to work at an international company or international organization?
samples.transcript: Oh, that is what I ask myself a lot too. I think most of the people that choose my major, they choose it because they want to change something. At least we believe we want to change how the things work. And we want also to raise awareness. Like what I try to do, by studying and, by talking with my friends is always like to try to make people understand how things actually are and how many stereotypes we do have, in terms of our, like politics and our environment and everything related. Like for example, nowadays even related to, health and like, you know, the vaccine and everything. So I do believe, that reading and studying and mostly discussing with people helps. And that is why most of people choose to work for international organization because it kind of feels like you actually changing people's minds and you make them believe that something can change and we can do it together. So. Yeah, that definitely sounds like a great reason to join an international organization. Okay, thank you so much for answering all my questions. I thought you did really well, and I hope you have a great day. Thank you. Okay, I am just going to ask you some post-test questions, overall feelings and opinions about the test.

samples.question: Do you like traveling to new places or returning to the same ones?
samples.transcript: For me, I would prefer traveling to various places because I am kind of an extrovert and I like to explore new things. And well, I like to find out about what people in other regions, other places, areas think and what are their costumes. you know, just wandering around one place is really boring and, it gives me the feeling of, well, boredom and monotonous stuff.
